nodes.bodyText:
This change breaks my client using openapi-generator-cli-5.0.0-20200127.021040-34.jar
We have api endpoints which allow Any Auth method. This function needs an overhaul, because it simply picks the last configured setting in the array, instead of the one which has actually been specified in the Configuration instance...
Preserving this line makes the code do the right thing...
if not auth_setting['value']:
                continue

This is the error we get without the line:-
  Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched

  File "/home/circleci/app/snap_usertracking/tests/test_client_api.py", line 665, in test_post_apikey

  File "/home/circleci/app/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/urllib3/request.py", line 171, in request_encode_body

  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/http/client.py", line 1239, in putheader

TypeError: expected string or bytes-like object

We have api endpoints which allow Any Auth method.

Can you clarify a bit what you mean by "Any" auth?
Also, to help me understand better, in your case, which security scheme has an auth_setting item with 'value' set to None? Sorry unfortunately it's hard to map the line numbers from the stack trace because that code is generated and line numbers can change depending on the OAS spec.
In the new configuration.mustache, the auth_settings are added only when the corresponding parameters have been set in the Configuration class. So there should not be an item in the auth_settings unless your client has configured it.
Note that previously, auth_settings() was unconditionally returning an array of items, even if the items in the array had no matching config parameters in "Configuration".
ahh, I have a custom configuration.mustache but based on an older version.... I'll try updating it and see if that works...

ahh, I have a custom configuration.mustache but based on an older version.... I'll try updating it and see if that works...

I see. Let me know how it goes.
